TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ApplicationTokenProvider extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Rest.ITokenProvider

Docs.summary: Provides tokens for Azure Active Directory applications.

MemberSignature.Value: public ApplicationTokenProvider (Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationContext context, string tokenAudience, Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.ClientAssertionCertificate certificate, Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationResult authenticationResult);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationContext context, string tokenAudience, class Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.ClientAssertionCertificate certificate, class Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationResult authenticationResult) cil managed

Docs.param: The authentication context to use when retrieving tokens.
The token audience to use when retrieving tokens.
The certificate associated with Active Directory application.
The token details provided when authenticating with the client credentials.
Docs.summary: Create an application token provider that can retrieve tokens for the given application from the given context, using the given audience and certificate. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Rest.ServiceClientCredentials> LoginSilentAsync (string domain, Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.ClientCredential credential);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Rest.ServiceClientCredentials> LoginSilentAsync(string domain, class Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.ClientCredential credential) cil managed

Docs.param: The active directory domain or tenantId to authenticate with.
The client credential (client id and secret) for this active directory application.
Docs.summary: Creates ServiceClientCredentials for authenticating requests as an active directory application using a client credential. Uses the default token cache and the default service settings for azure resource manager (authority, token audience) during authentication. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
Docs.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can authenticate http requests as the given application.
